title: Nearly 100 dead after Brazil's 'Imperial City' becomes latest natural disaster victim
description: At least 94 people have died in the Brazilian mountain city of Petropolis, local officials said Wednesday, after heavy rains triggered landslides that washed out streets, swept away cars and buried homes.

title: The bitter resistance to multi-racial democracy
description: America has a long history of passing voter suppression laws. On the latest Reality Check, John Avlon speaks with historian Kate Masur and the Brennan Center's Michael Waldman about the significance of the 15th Amendment and how recent moves from the Supreme Court have reduced the power of the Voting Rights Act of 1965 signed by Lyndon B Johnson.

title: This terrifying fall through trap door has surprising ending
description: Security cameras at a mall in Istanbul captured the moment a distracted boy fell down a hole, according to Reuters. See what cushions his landing.

title: Tesla cars under investigation after reports of unexpected braking
description: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration is investigating reports of Teslas braking unexpectedly while using Autopilot.

title: How a beloved orange tabby cat became a voice for America's union workers
description: An orange tabby cat named Jorts has become something of a mascot of the labor movement in America.

title: Moscow accused of 'escalatory move' as No. 2 US envoy expelled
description: The United States on Thursday accused Russia of having expelled the second-most senior diplomat at the US embassy in Moscow without any justification, calling it an "escalatory" move at a time of heightened alert over the Ukraine crisis.

title: Apple investors urged to vote against a nearly $100 million pay package for CEO Tim Cook
description: Apple is the most valuable company on the planet. And as a reward for the iPhone maker's success, CEO Tim Cook stands to receive nearly $100 million in compensation for 2021.

title: We tested Apple's new option to unlock an iPhone while wearing a mask
description: I stood outside a busy New York City subway stop recently, dressed like a celebrity trying not to be recognized. My face was covered with sunglasses, a baseball cap and my black KN95 mask.

title: Tom Hanks' son Chet says he didn't have a 'strong male role model' growing up
description: Chet Hanks is reflecting on growing up the child of famous parents, Tom Hanks and Rita Wilson.

title: 8,500-year-old buildings discovered in UAE
description: Archaeologists in the United Arab Emirates have uncovered the country's oldest known buildings, dating back at least 8,500 years.

title: World's first electric plane start up parts ways with CEO in mysterious rift
description: Eviation, the company behind what is supposed to be the world's first all-electric passenger airplane, has undergone an unexpected change in leadership just before the plane's projected first flight -- and the company and the now-former CEO are offering different takes on the situation.

title: Reporter who saw Kamila Valieva's routine calls it 'shocking'
description: CNN sports analyst Christine Brennan and CNN contributor Patrick McEnroe react to Russia Olympic Committee figure skater Kamila Valieva's fourth place finish in the women's individual figure skating event.

title: Dogs can recognize their owners just by their voice
description: You might already be sure your dog can recognize you by your voice, but they might not even need their vision or smell to guide them, according to a new study.

title: Trump social media app gearing up for launch
description: Conservative figures are increasingly promoting Truth Social, the alternative social media app backed by former President Donald Trump, as the platform undergoes pre-launch testing.

title: Aerial videos show destruction after deadly Brazil landslides
description: More than 90 people have died after heavy rainfall triggered flooding and landslides in Petrópolis, Brazil, according to local officials.

title: Trump's response to accounting firm may get him in trouble
description: The New York Attorney General wants a judge to compel Donald Trump to testify and is using a public statement he made about the accounting firm Mazars against him. CNN's Kara Scannell reports.

title: Elon Musk's Neuralink confirms monkeys died in project, denies animal cruelty claims
description: Elon Musk's implant company Neuralink, which aims to enable brains to connect and communicate with computers, has acknowledged that monkeys died as part of its testing procedures, but denies allegations of animal cruelty.

title: French-led forces to withdraw from Mali
description: France and Western countries involved in French-led anti-terrorist operations in West Africa will begin their withdraw from Mali, French President Emmanuel Macron said Thursday.

title: How this avgeek turned his hobby into a job
description: Asked to choose an icon of beauty, most people might think of a landscape, a city skyline or a work of art.

title: The artist behind 'Fearless Girl' wants to spread her message far and wide. A lawsuit is getting in the way
description: Five years after first appearing on the cobblestones of Wall Street, the "Fearless Girl" statue -- a petite but controversial symbol for gender equality -- is taking on a new digital form.

title: Surprising world of Stonehenge revealed in new exhibition
description: The distinctive silhouette of Stonehenge in the flat landscape of Salisbury plain in southwest England is instantly and iconically familiar.

title: Brutal killing of a mother and son in 1994 is solved through DNA evidence, police say
description: A cold case from 1994 -- the brutal killing of a mother and her son in a Seattle suburb -- has allegedly been solved, according to court documents filed this week.

title: Myth, magic and monsters: This photographer is creating Black fantasy water creatures
description: When you think of mermaids, it's hard not to picture the fish-tailed princess imagined by Hans Christian Andersen in his classic fairy tale: "her skin was as clear and delicate as a rose petal, and her eyes as blue as the deepest sea."

title: 2 truths and a lie about why you are butting heads with your teen
description: The teenage brain undergoes a major renovation, and it can be a messy, stressful and uneven process.

title: Video of police breaking up a fight between Black teen and White teen in mall prompts outrage
description: A video showing police officers breaking up a fight between a Black teenager and a White teenager at a New Jersey mall has prompted outrage over the police response.

title: US cranks up the information warfare against Putin
description: Far from buying into claims the Ukraine showdown is easing, the United States is cranking up its relentless informational warfare campaign against Russia, keeping the world on high alert for a possible invasion of Ukraine.

title: 40-year-old gold medalist returns home to a hero's welcome
description: CNN's John Berman speaks with 40-year-old Olympian Nick Baumgartner, the oldest athlete to compete for the United States at the Beijing Olympics. Baumgartner won a gold medal in the mixed team snowboard cross event with fellow "'80s baby" Lindsey Jacobellis.

title: The last of Canada's Covid-19 demonstrations may end soon
description: A nearly three-week protest in Ottawa over mandated Covid-19 precautions in Canada may be approaching its end as police tell demonstrators to either leave immediately or face legal consequences.

title: At least 13 dead after wedding guests fall into well at Indian ceremony
description: At least 13 people, including a one-year-old child, have died after falling into a well during a wedding ceremony in northern India, authorities from Uttar Pradesh state said on Wednesday.

title: Terrifying scene as floodwater carries a car after torrential rain
description: At least 94 people have died in landslides and flooding caused by heavy rains in Petropolis, a town in Brazil's Rio de Janeiro state, according to Brazil's Civil Defense Secretariat, CNN affiliate CNN Brasil reports.

title: Comedian jokes about making history hosting the Oscars
description: After years without a host, the Academy Awards aim to make history with three women emcees in Wanda Sykes, Amy Schumer and Regina Hall. It will also be the first time since 1987 that the Oscars has had three hosts.

title: Here's how women's figure skating is now scored (and why stamina often leads to more points)
description: Gone are the days when Olympic figure skating was scored solely at the judges' discretion, with subjective points awarded on a 6.0 scale.

title: Pilot dies when plane collides with tractor-trailer on a North Carolina interstate
description: The pilot was killed after a small plane collided with a tractor-trailer on an interstate in North Carolina, authorities said Wednesday.

title: FAA Administrator Steve Dickson is resigning
description: The head of the Federal Aviation Administration is resigning.

title: Hong Kong's outbreak exposes the limits of zero-Covid -- but the government isn't budging
description: How to contain a runaway Covid outbreak, in a city committed to keeping cases at zero?

title: US says Russian hackers collected intelligence from American defense contractors
description: Russian government-backed hackers have managed to acquire sensitive information on the development and deployment of US weapons by breaching American defense contractors over the last two years, US security agencies said on Wednesday.

title: US says Russia increased troop presence near Ukraine
description: Russian forces massed along Ukraine's borders have increased by approximately 7,000 troops in recent days, the United States alleged Wednesday evening, despite claims from Moscow it was pulling back its troops.

title: Hear legal analyst's predictions for Supreme Court decisions this year
description: While participating in a Citizen by CNN event, legal analyst Joan Biskupic talks about how Supreme Court 6-3 rulings may foreshadow changes on decisions around abortion, religion, race and guns.

title: Analysis: Is Putin creating a pretext for war?
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin is a man who likes to keep his options open, and the Ukraine crisis is no exception: As the Kremlin leader signals his willingness to engage on the diplomatic front, he is also bolstering a case for war.

title: Swimmer dies after shark attack
description: A swimmer has died after being bitten by a shark at a beach in Sydney, Australia, authorities have said.

title: US and NATO presence grows in Poland amid potential threats against Ukraine
description: The US military and NATO are increasing their presence at the border of Ukraine and Poland amid the potential threat of a Russian invasion of Ukraine. CNN's Nick Paton Walsh reports.
